pages.text: Doryaspis is a primitive jawless fish which had canteen shaped body armor and branchial plates which extended out and curved downward in a triangular shape. Its name comes from the Greek 'doru' meaning spear and 'aspis' meaning shield, because of the way it looked, having what looks like a spear, extending out from above its mouth.
